// The University of Copenhagen Degrowth Network //

All of our activities and events revolve around the topic of degrowth and creating a just world for all.

We live in a world of multiple interlinked crises: climate breakdown, biodiversity collapse, widespread inequality, and rising authoritarianism. Through our activities, we explore how degrowth, decarbonization, decolonization, and expanded democratic practices (among others!) can serve as paths to a just society living within ecological limits.

We answer questions in biodiversity and climate change experiments and observational studies. We focus on food webs' taxonomic and functional composition and the processes they drive. Global meta-analyses and syntheses allow us to identify general principles across ecosystems. We believe that interdisciplinary research advances our understanding of the composition and functioning of ecological communities, how they function in a changing world, and how this is related to human well-being.
